units.name: vpx
units.description: Viewport pixel unit that converts to vw. Example: `font-size: 36vpx;` converts to `font-size: 9.6vw;` (based on 375px viewport)

units.name: maxvpx
units.description: Viewport pixel with minimum bound. Converts to `max(vw, Npx)`. Example: `font-size: 36maxvpx;` converts to `font-size: max(9.6vw, 36px);`

units.name: minvpx
units.description: Viewport pixel with maximum bound. Converts to `min(vw, Npx)`. Example: `font-size: 36minvpx;` converts to `font-size: min(9.6vw, 36px);`

units.name: cvpx
units.description: Clamped viewport pixel with both minimum and maximum bounds. Converts to `clamp(minPx, vw, maxPx)`. Example: `font-size: 36cvpx;` converts to `font-size: clamp(36px, 9.6vw, 36px);`

functions.name: linear-vpx
functions.description:
Linear interpolation function for fluid responsive design. Generates calc() expression with optional clamp() wrapper.

Syntax:
- Full form: linear-vpx(minValue, maxValue, minViewportWidth, maxViewportWidth)
- Short form: linear-vpx(minValue, maxValue) - uses default viewport range from config

Example:
- `width: linear-vpx(840, 1000, 1200, 1920);` converts to `width: clamp(840px, calc(840px + 160 * (100vw - 1200px) / 720), 1000px);`
- `font-size: linear-vpx(16, 24);` uses configured linearMinWidth and linearMaxWidth
